text: Neraudia melastomifolia, known as maaloa in Hawaiian, is a species of flowering plant in the nettle family, Urticaceae, that is endemic to Hawaii. It is a shrub or small tree, reaching a height of up to . N. melastomifolia inhabits coastal mesic, mixed mesic, and wet forests at elevations of on Kauai Oahu, Molokai, and Maui. It is threatened by habitat loss. ==References== melastomifolia Category:Endemic flora of Hawaii Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Neraudia melastomifolia
